intro: Ficinia atrostachya, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and narrow, linear leaves. It produces small, spike-like inflorescences that contain tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Ficinia atrostachya typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and other moist environments, playing a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
